verses.verse: I made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with mine eyes;<WH5869> why<WH4100> then should I think<WH995> upon<WH5921> a maid?<WH1330>
For what<WH4100> portion<WH2506> of God<WH433> is there from above?<WH4480> <WH4605> and what inheritance<WH5159> of the Almighty<WH7706> from on high?<WH4480> <WH4791>
Is not<WH3808> destruction<WH343> to the wicked?<WH5767> and a strange<WH5235> punishment to the workers<WH6466> of iniquity?<WH205>
Doth not<WH3808> he<WH1931> see<WH7200> my ways,<WH1870> and count<WH5608> all<WH3605> my steps?<WH6806>
If <WH518> I have walked<WH1980> with<WH5973> vanity,<WH7723> or if my foot<WH7272> hath hasted<WH2363> to<WH5921> deceit;<WH4820>
Let me be weighed<WH8254> in an even<WH6664> balance,<WH3976> that God<WH433> may know<WH3045> mine integrity.<WH8538>

If <WH518> my step<WH838> hath turned<WH5186> out of<WH4480> the way,<WH1870> and mine heart<WH3820> walked<WH1980> after<WH310> mine eyes,<WH5869> and if any blot<WH3971> hath cleaved<WH1692> to mine hands;<WH3709>
Then let me sow,<WH2232> and let another<WH312> eat;<WH398> yea, let my offspring<WH6631> be rooted out.<WH8327>
If <WH518> mine heart<WH3820> have been deceived<WH6601> by<WH5921> a woman,<WH802> or if I have laid wait<WH693> at<WH5921> my neighbor's<WH7453> door;<WH6607>
Then let my wife<WH802> grind<WH2912> unto another,<WH312> and let others<WH312> bow down<WH3766> upon<WH5921> her.
For <WH3588> this<WH1931> is a heinous crime;<WH2154> yea, it<WH1931> is an iniquity<WH5771> to be punished by the judges.<WH6414>
For <WH3588> it<WH1931> is a fire<WH784> that consumeth<WH398> to<WH5704> destruction,<WH11> and would root out<WH8327> all<WH3605> mine increase.<WH8393>
If <WH518> I did despise<WH3988> the cause<WH4941> of my manservant<WH5650> or of my maidservant,<WH519> when they contended<WH7378> with<WH5978> me;
What <WH4100> then shall I do<WH6213> when<WH3588> God<WH410> riseth up?<WH6965> and when<WH3588> he visiteth,<WH6485> what<WH4100> shall I answer<WH7725> him?
Did not<WH3808> he that made<WH6213> me in the womb<WH990> make<WH6213> him? and did not one<WH259> fashion<WH3559> us in the womb?<WH7358>
If <WH518> I have withheld<WH4513> the poor<WH1800> from their desire,<WH4480> <WH2656> or have caused the eyes<WH5869> of the widow<WH490> to fail;<WH3615>
Or have eaten<WH398> my morsel<WH6595> myself alone,<WH905> and the fatherless<WH3490> hath not<WH3808> eaten<WH398> thereof;<WH4480>
(For <WH3588> from my youth<WH4480> <WH5271> he was brought up<WH1431> with me, as with a father,<WH1> and I have guided<WH5148> her from my mother's<WH517> womb;)<WH4480> <WH990>
If <WH518> I have seen<WH7200> any perish<WH6> for want<WH4480> <WH1097> of clothing,<WH3830> or any poor<WH34> without<WH369> covering;<WH3682>
If <WH518> his loins<WH2504> have not<WH3808> blessed<WH1288> me, and if he were not warmed<WH2552> with the fleece<WH4480> <WH1488> of my sheep;<WH3532>
If <WH518> I have lifted up<WH5130> my hand<WH3027> against<WH5921> the fatherless,<WH3490> when<WH3588> I saw<WH7200> my help<WH5833> in the gate: <WH8179>
Then let mine arm<WH3802> fall<WH5307> from my shoulder blade,<WH4480> <WH7929> and mine arm<WH248> be broken<WH7665> from the bone.<WH4480> <WH7070>
For <WH3588> destruction<WH343> from God<WH410> was a terror<WH6343> to<WH413> me, and by reason of his highness<WH4480> <WH7613> I could<WH3201> not<WH3808> endure.
If <WH518> I have made<WH7760> gold<WH2091> my hope,<WH3689> or have said<WH559> to the fine gold,<WH3800> Thou art my confidence;<WH4009>
If <WH518> I rejoiced<WH8055> because<WH3588> my wealth<WH2428> was great,<WH7227> and because<WH3588> mine hand<WH3027> had gotten<WH4672> much;<WH3524>
If <WH518> I beheld<WH7200> the sun<WH216> when<WH3588> it shined,<WH1984> or the moon<WH3394> walking<WH1980> in brightness;<WH3368>
And my heart<WH3820> hath been secretly<WH5643> enticed,<WH6601> or my mouth<WH6310> hath kissed<WH5401> my hand: <WH3027>
This <WH1931> also<WH1571> were an iniquity<WH5771> to be punished by the judge:<WH6416> for<WH3588> I should have denied<WH3584> the God<WH410> that is above.<WH4480> <WH4605>
If <WH518> I rejoiced<WH8055> at the destruction<WH6365> of him that hated<WH8130> me, or lifted up myself<WH5782> when<WH3588> evil<WH7451> found<WH4672> him:
Neither <WH3808> have I suffered<WH5414> my mouth<WH2441> to sin<WH2398> by wishing<WH7592> a curse<WH423> to his soul.<WH5315>
If <WH518> the men<WH4962> of my tabernacle<WH168> said<WH559> not,<WH3808> Oh that<WH4310> we had<WH5414> of his flesh!<WH4480> <WH1320> we cannot<WH3808> be satisfied.<WH7646>
The stranger<WH1616> did not<WH3808> lodge<WH3885> in the street:<WH2351> but I opened<WH6605> my doors<WH1817> to the traveler.<WH734>
If <WH518> I covered<WH3680> my transgressions<WH6588> as Adam,<WH121> by hiding<WH2934> mine iniquity<WH5771> in my bosom: <WH2243>

Did I fear<WH6206> a great<WH7227> multitude,<WH1995> or did the contempt<WH937> of families<WH4940> terrify<WH2865> me, that I kept silence,<WH1826> and went not out<WH3318> <WH3808> of the door?<WH6607>

Oh that<WH4310> one would<WH5414> hear<WH8085> me! behold,<WH2005> my desire<WH8420> is, that the Almighty<WH7706> would answer<WH6030> me, and that mine adversary<WH376> <WH7379> had written<WH3789> a book.<WH5612>
Surely <WH518> I would take<WH5375> it upon<WH5921> my shoulder,<WH7926> and bind<WH6029> it as a crown<WH5850> to me.
I would declare<WH5046> unto him the number<WH4557> of my steps;<WH6806> as<WH3644> a prince<WH5057> would I go near unto<WH7126> him.
If <WH518> my land<WH127> cry<WH2199> against<WH5921> me, or that the furrows<WH8525> likewise<WH3162> thereof complain;<WH1058>
If <WH518> I have eaten<WH398> the fruits<WH3581> thereof without<WH1097> money,<WH3701> or have caused the owners<WH1167> thereof to lose<WH5301> their life: <WH5315>
Let thistles<WH2336> grow<WH3318> instead<WH8478> of wheat,<WH2406> and cockle<WH890> instead<WH8478> of barley.<WH8184> The words<WH1697> of Job<WH347> are ended.<WH8552>
